title: Coffee Shop Receipt
description: Achieng’ runs a small café in Kisumu. At the end of each sale, she wants a program that asks for the prices of items purchased and then prints the total bill along with tax.

title: Train Ticket Calculator
description: Kamau is building a ticket system for the Nairobi–Mombasa SGR. The program should take a passenger’s age and distance of travel, then calculate the fare (children get 50% off, seniors get 30% off).

title: Student Grader
description: Wanjiru is a teacher in Nakuru who spends hours grading. She wants a program where she enters a student’s marks, and the program prints their grade (A, B, C, etc.).

title: Password Checker
description: Otieno often sets weak passwords and forgets them. He wants a program that asks the user to enter a password and checks if it is at least 8 characters long. If not, the program should warn him.

title: Temperature Converter
description: Chebet is traveling to the U.S. and struggles with Fahrenheit vs Celsius. She wants a small program where she can type a temperature in Celsius and get it converted to Fahrenheit (and vice versa).

title: Number Guessing Game
description: Mwangi is bored while waiting in traffic. He wants a program that randomly picks a number between 1 and 100, and the user has to guess it. The program should give hints ('too high' or 'too low').

title: Bank ATM Simulator
description: Amina is designing a mini ATM system for her ICT class project. She wants a program that lets users check balance, deposit money, and withdraw money (with checks so balance never goes negative).
